字符的表现形式集合称为字型（Glyph）。

Any one of these various concrete forms of a character is called a Glyph .

一些情况下，单个字符可由多个字体组成；另一种情况，单个字体由多个字符组成。后一种情况称为连字（Ligatures）。

In some case a character may be represented by multiple glyphs. In other cases, a single glyph may represent multiple characters,as in the case of a ligature, or joined letter.

字体（Typefaces）与 字型（Fonts）

Typeface

A typeface(also known as font family) is a set of visually related shapes for some or all of the characters in a written language.

from Wikipedia: a typeface (also known as font family) is a set of one or more fonts each composed of glyphs that share common design features. Each font of a typeface has a specific weight, style, condensation, width, slant, italicization, ornamentation, and designer or foundry (and formerly size, in metal fonts).

A typestyle, or simply style(also called traits), is a distinguishing visual characteristic of a typeface, such as, such as bold, italic, condensed, expanded, narrow, small caps, poster fonts, and fixed pitch.

字体和字体簇

A font is a series of glyphs depicting the characters in a consistent size, typeface, and typestyle. A font family (also known as Typeface) is a group of fonts that share a typeface but differ in typestyle.

3. Text Layout

Text layout is the process of arranging glyphs on a display device, in an area called a text view , which represents an area similar to a page in traditional typesetting.

The order in which glyphs are laid out relative to each other is called text direction.

To create lines from a string of glyphs, the layout engine must perform line breaking by finding a point at which to end one line and begin the next.

The layout manager lays out glyphs along an invisible line called the baseline.
